intro: Isodon excisus f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered isodon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, giving it its distinguishing name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
